result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael B. Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No violent contact with victim.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael B. Shaw

defendant.name: Shaw, Michael B.
defendant.address: 3863 Bay Shore Dr, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael B. Shaw in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Defendant Michael B. Shaw in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Michael B. Shaw in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Defendant Michael B. Shaw in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that revocation paperwork should be arriving from DOC within a couple of days, has received offer from State, requests rescheduling in about a week.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Michael B. Shaw in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Defendant Michael B. Shaw in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding Amended Complaint.   Defense enters not guilty pleas, requests date in about 2 weeks to resolve this case and revocation file at the same time.  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael B. Shaw in court, in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant thinks he should get an attorney, but was just here on identical charges two weeks ago and spent $1500 on an attorney for that case, doesn't think an attorney will tell him anything different. Court reviews right to Counsel. Defendant will get an attorney, thinks it will take about a week. Bond continues as is. Discussion regarding Defendant's status on probation hold.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
No violent contact with JK. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Michael B. Shaw appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/7/16, 10:00.
